body_html:
The build-in interfaces(both tf.data and csv op) are too slow for large scale data.
Early tests (at about 2016-11 with tensorflow 1.0 or earlier version) shows that use cython + pandas + feeddict to load csv data would be 2~5x speed up than the build-in ops.

A problem using pandas + feeddict is that it blocks with the python GIL and python codes is still slow, thus the speed up would NOT scale when number of threads is over 5.

So I'm wondering if it is possible to translate the codes into pure cpp so that it could benefit from the tf.queue ops.

So I'm wondering if it is possible to translate the codes into pure cpp so that it could benefit from the tf.queue ops.
body:
The build-in interfaces(both tf.data and csv op) are too slow for large scale data. 
Early tests (at about 2016-11 with tensorflow 1.0 or earlier version) shows that use cython + pandas + feeddict to load csv data would be 2~5x speed up than the build-in ops.

A problem using pandas + feeddict is that it blocks with the python GIL and python codes is still slow, thus the speed up would NOT scale when number of threads is over 5.

So I'm wondering if it is possible to translate the codes into pure cpp so that it could benefit from the tf.queue ops.
